transcript_chunks.text: Story number four EA has made 23 more of its accessibility patents free for any Studio to use this comes from Chris scolan at VGC that sounds this is good news yeah we're at end on some good news today Electronic Arts has added a further 23 patents to its ongoing patent pledge uh the pledge was initially launched in August 2021 with EA offering to share five of its previously protected patents which improved accessibility for players this has grown to 15 patents over the past few years and now a further 23 have been added bringing the total to 38 Pat patents according to EA any other game developer can use these patents without having to pay any money or risk being sued the newly added patents include the following Technologies as described by EA intelligent personalized speech recognition speech recognition system that improves the accuracy and efficiency of speech recognition by using personal bonom memes mappings for each user to better understand accent and other pronunciation

speech recognition system that improves the accuracy and efficiency of speech recognition by using personal bonom memes mappings for each user to better understand accent and other pronunciation variation such as those resulting from speech impairments very cool phonm uh phonm yeah it's like a like phonics like yeah makes sense makes sense uh generating expressive speech audio from text Data A system that generates expressive speech audio from text Data provides more control and personalization of the generated speech based on desired speaking style and speaker attributes also very cool generating speech in the voice of a player of a video game voice aging using machine learning emotion-based music style change using deep learning interesting so A system that infers a player's emotion while playing a video game and tunes the background soundtrack of the game to best fit that emotion huh that's pretty crazy cool gra from the back just said do we just feel an earthquake I did get a
